name: AdlibBlaster
tagline: A VST/AU instrument using the DOSBox OPL2 emulation
body:
## Download binaries

### 0.9 beta

[Windows VST (32-bit DLL)](https://github.com/bsutherland/JuceOPLVSTi/releases/download/0.9-beta/JuceOPLVSTi.dll)

[Mac OS X (32/64-bit UB)](https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B3RK-KfkucDQfm5EVnF1UWtxQmRtWlg5dXY3b3hvaUtkb1JKekNTdWFLVUphaU1Fb3J0bjA&authuser=0)

## About the binaries

This is a pre-release of the Mac OS X port of JuceOPLVSTi together with the more stable Windows releases. The Mac builds seems to be most stable with the VSTi at the moment. The AU works find but the first time it is loaded you will greeted with a loud awful noise so be warned! The VST3 version is completely untested

## What is it?

The OPL2 is a simple 2-operator digital FM sound chip from the late 80s, used in PC sound cards like the Adlib and original Sound Blaster. This VST instrument allows you to program an emulated OPL2 chip.

![Screenshot (beta release)](https://raw.github.com/bsutherland/JuceOPLVSTi/gh-pages/images/screenshot_0-9_beta.png)

[Demo on YouTube](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HI7U5XxTSW0) (music from PC version of Syndicate, tracked in Renoise).

## Source

GPL v2 licensed.

[https://github.com/bsutherland/JuceOPLVSTi](https://github.com/bsutherland/JuceOPLVSTi)

## Issues

[https://github.com/bsutherland/JuceOPLVSTi/issues](https://github.com/bsutherland/JuceOPLVSTi/issues)
